definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: The annoying thing about the scheme is that it's confusing.
sentences.chinese: 这项计划可气的地方是它让人一头雾水。

definition: to be unable to make any sense of the matter/to be at a loss
amidst the clouds and mist/(fig.) mystified/puzzled
not to understand the situation/unaware of the ins and outs
to not know the reason/to not know what to do
see 百思不解[bai3 si1 bu4 jie3]
pinyin: bai3 si1 bu4 de2 qi2 jie3

definition: to not understand/to be puzzled by/indissoluble
to feel dizzy/to be confused/to be at a loss/to stare blankly/Taiwan pr. [fa1 meng2]
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
